intro: Cyrtandra × honolulensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Cyrtandra × honolulensis is adapted to the moist, shaded environments of Hawaiian rainforests.
